properties.areaDesc: Coastal Chatham; Beaufort; Charleston; Coastal Colleton; Coastal Jasper
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 5:13PM EST by NWS Charleston SC
properties.description:
Webcam and surface observations show sea fog is developing near
the Savannah River Entrance late this afternoon. The sea fog is
expected to slowly expand inland across portions of the lower
South Carolina coast into Chatham County, Georgia, later this
evening as warm, moist air impacts the region. Visibility in the
fog could drop as low as 1/4 mile or less at times. A Dense Fog
Advisory could be needed for some areas over the coming hours.

Motorists should be alert for rapidly changing conditions. Mariners
traveling the Intracoastal Waterway as well as nearby rivers such
as the Broad River, Savannah River, Stono River, Wando River,
Cooper River and the Ashley River should also be alert for areas
of very low visibility.
properties.instruction:
If driving, slow down and leave extra distance ahead of you in
case a sudden stop is needed.

NWSheadline: SEA FOG COULD MOVE INLAND ALONG THE LOWER SOUTH CAROLINA AND FAR UPPER GEORGIA COAST THIS EVENING
